name: Hotel Deauville

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Deauvill three times. The last was for 3 weeks in July/Aug 2005.
reviews.title: The old queen

reviews.text: Thanks to Tripadvisor our expectations of this hotel were not high! we booked it a while back as part of a twin centre with a hotel in Varadero. Interestingly enough we booked this holiday with Airtours and I see that the hotel is no longer featured in the summer 2007 brochures hmmm.........
reviews.title: Fine - until you see some of the other hotels in Havana!
Just awful
reviews.text: To be honest its not too bad. My boyfriend and I are both well travelled backpackers who've stayed in a lot worse. The reception and downstairs area is fine. Rooms are a bit grubby but our room was massive and had a great view. Bathroom was spotless though! What really lets the hotel down is the shabby corridors, Pool area and poor breakfast. Our first morning we arrived for much needed food to find about 10 pieces of fruit on the buffet people were fighting over! Eventually managed to wangle some toast from one of the waiters. Our rep couldn't apologise enough at our welcome meeting that morning and said reasons for it being so poor was they hotel had miscalculated the number of people needing fed (or something similar!) the next 3 days of our stay, the food was fine, not great but certainly edible.
Best thing about the hotel is the wee cat that lives around the pool area - double of our cat at home (if skinnier!) very cute, make sure you feed it!
reviews.title: AQ loves the Deauville!
Avoid this hotel
reviews.text: Overall as long as you know what to expect you should be fine. The thing that really galled us about the experience was that we had originally been booked into the hotel Sevilla as part of a thompsons package. They pulled the hotel for health and safety reasons (god knows why) and so we ended up in the Deauville. When we saw the Sevilla we were gutted! its really lovely, go there for lunch and a mojito!
Cannot fault Havana and Cuba in general though. We had a wicke time and I would say that our experience in the Deauville didn't attract from it at all. Have fun!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic location
Not that bad!!
reviews.text: Hum ... Our paths could have crossed (re: "Avoid at all costs"). I stayed at the Deauville Feb. 3 to Feb. 17, 2006 ...

reviews.title: Avoid at all costs.
reviews.text: The room was clean, though not luxurious. No cockroaches on the 11th floor. Magnificent view. Went to bed and woke up to the sound of the waves pounding the walls of the Malecon since I felt safe leaving the windows open at night.
The staff was courteous to me at all times. And competent. Especially the friendly lobby bar staff.
reviews.title: PLEASE AVOID!!!
this hotel is fine
reviews.text: The food, of course, was awfull. But one does not go to Habana for the cuisine, although it had improved from my previous visit, three years ago.

reviews.title: Welcome to Dumpsville - Population Us.
reviews.text: This is a 3-star hotel, for heavens' sake. I've seen a lot worse, in London (on Sussex Gardens, for instance) at three times the price. And with the score of police officers on the streets at all times, its probably safer than the Paddington Station area.
The staff very unhelpful or ignoring your quiries, window in room not able to open or shut unless with much force, towels in room not changed even when it was quite clear they were dirty.
reviews.title: don't go there

reviews.text: had to constantly ask for plates/knives/cups/serviettes at breakfast.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: was told i couldnt have just chips for lunch (they were obviously trying to sell me more to eat for lunch) then to be told its because their cooker was broken, although about an hour earlier, someone quite clearly had eaten just a plate of chips.
reviews.title: All in all pretty good for a 2 star hotel in Cuba!!!!

likes.liked: — The great views, convenient location and the comfortable beds
likes.disliked: — it can only be the breakfast

reviews.text: they tried to get me to pay for a glass that had apparantly gone missing, although i told them i had left it in the room across from me. The rep had said they just wanted to know what had happened to it, for some kind of inventory they had to do for each room, which i clearly do not believe.

Room with a view
reviews.text: this is quite clearly a Fawlty Towers hotel.

description: This strategically located hotel is right on the Malecón seafront. The situation makes the hotel ideal for visits to the old colonial city and equally ideal as a starting point for the renowned Havana nightlife
